page.title: 10EMPLOYMENT
page.content: { LIFE ON THE DOLE David Williams lives at 11, Chapel St, Aberaman. He is 20 years old and has been unemployed since leaving school at 16. He is a typical example of the many young unemployed people in Aberdare. He now receives Â£23.50 per week,paid fortnightly. He gives some money to his parents and with the little left over he buys an L.P. or some clothes to cheer him up. He describes a typical day in one word - "boring"! He visits the job centre twice a week,watches T.V. and goes for long walks. He, like so many others in the same situation,expressed anger,frustration and despondency. "Looking for a permanent job is like looking for diamonds in the River Cynon," says David. He feels depressed and that he has been let down by society.
